When their friend Marvin asks Hap and Leonard to look into a cold-case double homicide, theyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re more than happy to play private investigators: they like trouble, and they especially like getting paid to find it. It turns out that both of the victims were set to inherit serious money, and one of them ran with a vampire cult. The more closely Hap and Leonard look over the crime-scene photos, the more they see, including the image of a red devilÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s head painted on a tree. A little research turns up a slew of murders with that same fiendish signature. And if thatÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s not enough, Leonard has taken to wearing a deerstalker cap . . . Will this be the case that finally sends Hap over the edge?

Full up with LansdaleÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s trademarkÃ¢â‚¬â€whip-smart dialogue, relentless pacing, and unorthodox-to-say-the-least charactersÃ¢â‚¬â€Devil Red is one rambunctious thrill ride by one hell of a writer.
